modules.description: This module handles parsing and transformation of OCaml core types into expressions and patterns, generating fresh variables, type representations, and identifiers during AST manipulation. It works directly with `core_type`, `expression`, `pattern`, and `Longident` structures, maintaining internal state through mutable references for variable naming and tracking. Concrete use cases include generating function arguments, type conversions, and constructing identifier expressions for type-driven code generation.

This module parses and transforms OCaml core types into expressions and patterns, generating fresh variables, type representations, and identifiers during AST manipulation. It operates on `core_type`, `expression`, `pattern`, and `Longident` structures, using mutable state to manage variable naming and tracking. It enables tasks like generating function arguments, performing type conversions, and building identifier expressions for type-driven code generation. For example, it can synthesize a function that converts a type into a corresponding runtime representation or generate fresh variables for pattern matching.
